Massive data is quite common for every successful e-commerce business. This is because apart from good products offered at amazing prices this factor makes all the e-shops be successful. It is this particular factor which has the ability to fine-tune the selling proposition for individuals. For any website the king is content and thus the serving game of stores, company information and catalog must be played efficiently with a system of content management that is excellent. If one has sound knowledge of their targeted audience then the following CMS must prove to be advantageous for managing websites, portals and blogs making the business reach newer heights. Here is a list of five of them.

  • Opencart
  • Magento
  • Business Catalyst
  • OSCSS
  • Prestashop

  1. Table of Contents

    Toggle
    • Opencart

    • Carving the right path

    Opencart

This is the particular system of cart shopping which has a user interface that is well defined and is user-friendly at the same time.  Hence if you have a business portal online you must employ an effective application for web development. This calls for hiring a reputable PHP development company India that has great knowledge of PHP, Static HTML and flash websites. Opencart with its amazing user interface facilitates site tweaking. One gets to take full control of shipping features and coupons. An online business can be created and participation can be made in e-commerce activities by internet merchants.

  1. Magento

This is an e-commerce platform that is growing at the fastest pace and thus Magento website development has become popular over the years. In the current scenario, it is serving plenty of internet merchants. It is also quite popular for offering a high degree of control and flexibility to the experience of users. The best part about this CMS is that it has high integration with more than fifty gateways of payments and Website optimizer of Google.

  1. Business Catalyst

This CMS is used for any typical website of e-commerce which may range from medium to small sizes. It provides the dedicated system of content management that has powers inbuilt for forums, shopping carts and jump-starting blogs. The analytics is quite easily understandable and helps in tracking customer activity and website visits. The user interface is simple and concise offering great support over live chat, email, and phone.

  1. OSCSS

The OSCSS is built on the foundation of a GPL code of the osCommerce. It is an application of the PHP exclusively built for shipping. It can be downloaded for free and uses XHTML 1.1 as the language for markup. Besides being used as the language for its own version CSS is used for layout presentation.

  1. Prestashop

An open platform for e-commerce that helps managing businesses in real time is the Prestashop. It provides features where there is full control of tracking, shipping, and inventory orders. There are a total of more than three hundred features which is equipped with WYSIWYG tools for editing. This is used for both the management of images and is also able to send payments to PayPal accounts directly.

Carving the right path

When the easiest CMS e-commerce is used that has the learning curve which is manageable the platform management is much empowered. There are more results in minimal time thus creating a great success opportunity for an e-commerce company.
